results.title: Generalisation, discrimination and motivation (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Stresses methods of conditioning by reinforcing operant behaviour. Demonstrates motivation by positive reinforcement, conditioning reinforcement, punishment, negative reinforcement, avoidance and control self-simulation, in laboratory experiments and other learning situations. Compares the efficacy of praise and other positive reinforcements to punishment and negative reinforcements.

results.title: Shaping various operants, various species (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ellen Reese and Charter Oak Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Considers conditioning in six steps: shaping, adaptation, situation, motivation, operant level and final performance. These are illustrated by conditioned lever pressing by rats, high jumping by dogs, manipulation of a talking parrot and learning of handwriting by children.

results.title: Sequences of behavior (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Behavior Theory in Practice”.
Shows procedure for conditioning homogeneous and heterogeneous behaviour chains. Demonstrates shaping of complex behaviour chains in pigeons, dogs in obedience trials, police dogs and guide dogs, showing practical application of laboratory findings

results.title: Shapes of progress
results.creator_credit: John Mallison, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films
results.brief_description: Modern industrial design in Britain. A number if different designers comment on their own work, and explain their individual approach to design. Illustrates how everything that is made has first to be designed, and how the work of designers in the modern world effects everyone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Mallison, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films

results.title: Shakespeare's island
results.creator_credit: Lorna Pegram, G. Buckland-Smith and Patricia Pictures
results.brief_description: Reviews Shakespeare’s life amid scenes of beautiful Warwickshire, which must have been familiar to Shakespeare as a boy. The film shows the influence that working in Stratford-upon-Avon has upon the players at the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre. It is centred round the production of “The Tempest” - Shakespeare’s last play. With Ian Richardson as Prospero and Ben Kingsley as Ariel.

results.title: Sexuality and communication
results.brief_description: At an Ontario Science Center Symposium two doctors discuss many aspects of human sexuality in light-hearted but extremely scholarly explanations involving role playing, diagramatic representation of male and female sex organs, intercourse, premature ejaculation, frigidity, masturbation, and shows the importance of attitudes and feelings.

results.title: Seward's folly
results.creator_credit: Charles Diltz and Hill & Anderson Productions
results.brief_description: Alaska, a land of vast stretches of snow became a part of the United States in 1867. This is a documentary on the life and times of the people and wildlife of Alaska.

results.title: Sestrieres 1949
results.creator_credit: Hugh Wyn Griffith and Oxford University Film Society
results.brief_description: This film is a photographic impression of a skiing holiday taken by 300 British students. No text and musical accompaniament acts as a narrative to the images we see. Great footage of skiers and Italian Alps. Music by Christofer Shaw and photography by Michael Warne, Charles Carson.

results.title: Sesame street show No.1. Part one
results.brief_description: Part of the famous television series for children which was evolved after months of research and planning. The series uses a mixture of puppets, film segments and animated cartoons, together with `on set’ live characters, all presented in segments short enough to be within the interest span of pre-school children.
